attributes.title: Figure 3. A In A Molecular And Morphological Characterization Of Oliver'S Parrot Snake, Leptophis Coeruleodorsus (Squamata: Serpentes: Colubridae) With The Description Of A New Species From Tobago
attributes.description: FIGURE 3. A comparison of Leptophis coeruleodorsus (CAS 231717 from Trinidad) profile and crown (A & B) with Leptophis haileyi sp. nov. (CAS 245313) profile and crown (C & D). Because Trinidad L. coeruleodorsus can have nine upper labials (a trait we have not found present in the Tobago population), this figure compares L. haileyi sp. nov. with a specimen of L. coeruleodorsus with nine upper labials.

attributes.title: Figure 4 In A Molecular And Morphological Characterization Of Oliver'S Parrot Snake, Leptophis Coeruleodorsus (Squamata: Serpentes: Colubridae) With The Description Of A New Species From Tobago
attributes.description: FIGURE 4. Known localities of Leptophis coeruleodorsus from Trinidad and Tobago and Venezuela are the white markers. The type locality for Leptophis haileyi is the green marker.

attributes.title: Figure 1 In Resolving An Enigma By Integrative Taxonomy: Madagascarophis Fuchsi (Serpentes: Lamprophiidae), A New Opisthoglyphous And Microendemic Snake From Northern Madagascar
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. (A) Bayesian tree of representative Madagascarophis samples, based on 2197 nucleotide positions of two mitochondrial (16 S rRNA, cytochrome b) and one nuclear gene (c- mos). Bayesian posterior probabilities are given above branches, parsimony bootstrap values below branches. (B) Median-joining haplotype network of c- mos sequences. Circles represent haplotypes, short lines crossing indicate nucleotide substitutions (no heterozygous sequences were observed in the cmos data set).

attributes.title: Figure 2 In Resolving An Enigma By Integrative Taxonomy: Madagascarophis Fuchsi (Serpentes: Lamprophiidae), A New Opisthoglyphous And Microendemic Snake From Northern Madagascar
attributes.description: FIGURE 2. Throat scalation in preserved specimens of Madagascarophis: (A) M. fuchsi sp. nov. (ZSM 2130 / 2007, holotype); (B) M. c. septentrionalis (MNHN 1985.391, holotype); (C) M. c. septentrionalis (MNHN 1985.391, paratype); (D) M. ocellatus (MNHN 1977.1056, holotype). The inframaxillaries (genials) are outlined in black. Not to scale.

attributes.title: Figure 3 In Resolving An Enigma By Integrative Taxonomy: Madagascarophis Fuchsi (Serpentes: Lamprophiidae), A New Opisthoglyphous And Microendemic Snake From Northern Madagascar
attributes.description: FIGURE 3. Holotype of Madagascarophis ocellatus (MNHN 1977.1056) in dorsal view.

attributes.title: Figure 4 In Resolving An Enigma By Integrative Taxonomy: Madagascarophis Fuchsi (Serpentes: Lamprophiidae), A New Opisthoglyphous And Microendemic Snake From Northern Madagascar
attributes.description: FIGURE 4. Head drawings of Madagascarophis fuchsi sp. nov. (holotype, ZSM 2130 / 2007). (A) Lateral view; (B) dorsal view. Drawings by Ruth Kühbandner.

attributes.title: Figure 5 In Resolving An Enigma By Integrative Taxonomy: Madagascarophis Fuchsi (Serpentes: Lamprophiidae), A New Opisthoglyphous And Microendemic Snake From Northern Madagascar
attributes.description: FIGURE 5. (A) Holotype of Madagascarophis fuchsi sp. nov. in life (ZSM 2130 / 2007). (B) Madagascarophis colubrinus septentrionalis from Windsor Castle (ZSM 2212 / 2007) in life, representing a typical color morph of the northernmost populations.

attributes.title: Figure 6 In Resolving An Enigma By Integrative Taxonomy: Madagascarophis Fuchsi (Serpentes: Lamprophiidae), A New Opisthoglyphous And Microendemic Snake From Northern Madagascar
attributes.description: FIGURE 6. Map of northern Madagascar showing localities of Madagascarophis specimens studied morphologically (see Table 1).

attributes.title: Figure 1 In A New Species Of Kukri Snake (Oligodon Fitzinger, 1826; Squamata: Colubridae) From The Cat Tien National Park, Southern Vietnam
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. Holotype (ZMMU R - 13865) portraits and head scalation in dorsal (A), lateral (B), and ventral views (C). Photographs and drawings by Anna B. Vassilieva and Vitaly L. Trounov.

attributes.title: Figure 2 In A New Species Of Kukri Snake (Oligodon Fitzinger, 1826; Squamata: Colubridae) From The Cat Tien National Park, Southern Vietnam
attributes.description: FIGURE 2. Holotype (ZMMU R - 13865) in life, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B). Photos by Anna B. Vassilieva.

attributes.title: Figure 3 In A New Species Of Kukri Snake (Oligodon Fitzinger, 1826; Squamata: Colubridae) From The Cat Tien National Park, Southern Vietnam
attributes.description: FIGURE 3. Holotype (ZMMU R - 13865) in preservative, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B). Photos by Anna B. Vassilieva and Vitaly L. Trounov.

attributes.title: Figure 4 In A New Species Of Kukri Snake (Oligodon Fitzinger, 1826; Squamata: Colubridae) From The Cat Tien National Park, Southern Vietnam
attributes.description: FIGURE 4. Variation in life coloration of Oligodon cattienensis sp. nov.: (A) ZFMK 88921 (juvenile paratype); (B) ZMMU R - 13866 adult male paratype; (C) ZMMU R - 13815 adult male paratype; (D) uncollected adult specimen from Cat Tien National Park. Photos by Anna B. Vassilieva, Vitaly L. Trounov, Eduard A. Galoyan, Peter Geissler and Robert Wayne Van Devender.

attributes.title: Figure 5 In A New Species Of Kukri Snake (Oligodon Fitzinger, 1826; Squamata: Colubridae) From The Cat Tien National Park, Southern Vietnam
attributes.description: FIGURE 5. Ventral coloration of Oligodon cattienensis sp. nov. in life: (A) adult male paratype (ZMMU R - 13866); juvenile paratype (ZFMK 88921). Photos by Anna B. Vassilieva, Vitaly L. Trounov and Peter Geissler.

attributes.title: Figure 6 In A New Species Of Kukri Snake (Oligodon Fitzinger, 1826; Squamata: Colubridae) From The Cat Tien National Park, Southern Vietnam
attributes.description: FIGURE 6. Intact (left on photograph) and dissected (right) hemipenes in preserved paratype ZMMU R - 13866. Photo by Anna B. Vassilieva and Vitaly L. Trounov.

attributes.title: Figure 1 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. Live specimen of Micrurus potyguara paratype, UFPB 4355, from João Pessoa, state of Paraíba, Brazil. Photo by Claudio Sampaio.

attributes.title: Figure 2 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 2. Dorsal and lateral views of the head of the holotypes of Micrurus potyguara UFPB 4359 (a, e), Micrurus lemniscatus carvalhoi USNM 76341 (b, f), Micrurus brasiliensis UMMZ 108880 (c, g) and Micrurus ibiboboca AMNH 3937 (d, h).

attributes.title: Figure 3 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 3. Graphic expression of the proportional triad pattern of the holotype of Micrurus potyguara UFPB 4359 (a) and the paratypes UFPB 4358 (b), UFPB 4361 (c), CAS 49297 (d), NRM 1685 (e), UFPB 4355 (f) compared with the holotypes of M. brasiliensis UMMZ 108880 (g), M. ibiboboca AMNH 3937 (h), and M. lemniscatus carvalhoi USNM 76341 (i).

attributes.title: Figure 4 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 4. Sulcate (left) and asulcate (right) views of the hemipenis of Micrurus potyguara (a), M. lemniscatus carvalhoi (b), M. brasiliensis (c) and M. ibiboboca (d). Scale bars = 5 mm.

attributes.title: Figure 5 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 5. Dorsal (a) and ventral (b) views of Micrurus potyguara holotype, UFPB 4359, from João Pessoa, state of Paraíba, Brazil.

attributes.title: Figure 6 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 6. Dorsal (a), lateral (b), and ventral (c) views of head and first body triad of Micrurus potyguara holotype, UFPB 4359. Drawings by Darlan T. Feitosa.

attributes.title: Figure 7 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 7. Geographic distribution of Micrurus potyguara (yellow diamonds), Micrurus l. carvalhoi (red circles), Micrurus ibiboboca (orange squares) and M. brasiliensis (purple diamonds) in Central and Northeastern Brazil.

attributes.title: Figure 8. M In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 8. M. potyguara type locality landscape. Tropical ombrophilous lowland coastal forests of Northeastern Brazil from Rio Grande do Norte to Espírito Santo states, known as " tabuleiros ".

attributes.title: Figure 9 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 9. Bivariate plot for the first two axes derived from scores of PCA analysis for males (A) and females (B) for M. ibiboboca, M. brasiliensis, M. l. carvalhoi e M. potyguara sp. nov. (95 % confidence regions).

attributes.title: Figure 10 In A New Species Of Triadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus Wagler, 1824 (Serpentes: Elapidae) From Northeastern Brazil
attributes.description: FIGURE 10. Bivariate plot for the first two axes derived from scores of DFA analysis for males (A) and females (B) for species M. ibiboboca, M. brasiliensis, M. l. carvalhoi e M. potyguara sp. nov. (95 % confidence regions).

attributes.title: Figure 1 In A New Species Of Kukri Snake (Colubridae: Oligodon Fitzinger, 1826) From The Phnom Samkos Wildlife Sanctuary, Cardamom Mountains, Southwest Cambodia
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. Map of Cambodia, illustrating the type locality of Oligodon kampucheaensis sp. nov. from the Phnom Samkos Wildlife Sanctuary, northwestern Cardamom Mountains, Cambodia.

data_centers.title: UC Berkeley Museum of Vertebrate Zoology
